stimulusHtml:
A cylindrical tank is filled with water, and the walls of the tank are insulated so that no energy is transferred into or out of the tank by thermal processes. Inside the tank are two heating elements, Heater X and Heater Y with resistances RX and RY, respectively. RX is greater than RY. The heaters are connected by wires to the same source of emf, and each is controlled by its own switch. (The switches and the source of emf are not shown in the figure.)

Which heater, run by itself, would take a longer time to increase the temperature of the water by an amount ΔT? What reasoning helps support the claim?
choicesHtml: Heater X takes longer to heat the water. The time it takes a heater to heat the water is directly proportional to the power dissipated in the heater, and the power dissipated is directly proportional to the heater’s resistance.

Heater X takes longer to heat the water. The time it takes a heater to heat the water is inversely proportional to the power dissipated in the heater, and the power dissipated is inversely proportional to the heater’s resistance.

Heater Y takes longer to heat the water. The time it takes a heater to heat the water is directly proportional to the power dissipated in the heater, and the power dissipated is inversely proportional to the heater’s resistance Y.

Heater Y takes longer to heat the water. The time it takes a heater to heat the water is inversely proportional to the power dissipated in the heater, and the power dissipated is directly proportional to the heater’s resistance.
